StorageLocation.$comment: Contains object details present in the S3 Bucket

Bucket.description: An Amazon S3 bucket identifier. This is the name of the S3 bucket.
Bucket.markdownDescription:
An Amazon S3 bucket identifier. This is the name of the S3 bucket.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

Key.description: The name of the zip file that contains the build files or script files.
Key.markdownDescription:
The name of the zip file that contains the build files or script files.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

ObjectVersion.description: The version of the file, if object versioning is turned on for the bucket. Amazon GameLift uses this information when retrieving files from your S3 bucket. To retrieve a specific version of the file, provide an object version. To retrieve the latest version of the file, do not set this parameter.
ObjectVersion.markdownDescription:
The version of the file, if object versioning is turned on for the bucket. Amazon GameLift uses this information when retrieving files from your S3 bucket. To retrieve a specific version of the file, provide an object version. To retrieve the latest version of the file, do not set this parameter.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an IAM role that allows Amazon GameLift to access the S3 bucket.
RoleArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an IAM role that allows Amazon GameLift to access the S3 bucket.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

StorageLocation.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length.
Key.markdownDescription:
The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 128  
Update requires: No interruption

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length.
Value.markdownDescription:
The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Update requires: No interruption

Tag.markdownDescription:
A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

BuildId.description: A unique identifier for a build to be deployed on the new fleet. If you are deploying the fleet with a custom game build, you must specify this property. The build must have been successfully uploaded to Amazon GameLift and be in a READY status. This fleet setting cannot be changed once the fleet is created.
BuildId.markdownDescription:
A unique identifier for a build to be deployed on the new fleet. If you are deploying the fleet with a custom game build, you must specify this property. The build must have been successfully uploaded to Amazon GameLift and be in a READY status. This fleet setting cannot be changed once the fleet is created.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

Name.description: A descriptive label that is associated with a build. Build names do not need to be unique.
Name.markdownDescription:
A descriptive label that is associated with a build. Build names do not need to be unique.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

OperatingSystem.description: The operating system that the game server binaries are built to run on. This value determines the type of fleet resources that you can use for this build. If your game build contains multiple executables, they all must run on the same operating system. If an operating system is not specified when creating a build, Amazon GameLift uses the default value (WINDOWS_2012). This value cannot be changed later.
OperatingSystem.markdownDescription:
The operating system that the game server binaries are built to run on. This value determines the type of fleet resources that you can use for this build. If your game build contains multiple executables, they all must run on the same operating system. If an operating system is not specified when creating a build, Amazon GameLift uses the default value (WINDOWS_2012). This value cannot be changed later.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: AMAZON_LINUX | AMAZON_LINUX_2 | AMAZON_LINUX_2023 | WINDOWS_2012 | WINDOWS_2016  
Update requires: Replacement

StorageLocation.description: Information indicating where your game build files are stored. Use this parameter only when creating a build with files stored in an Amazon S3 bucket that you own. The storage location must specify an Amazon S3 bucket name and key. The location must also specify a role ARN that you set up to allow Amazon GameLift to access your Amazon S3 bucket. The S3 bucket and your new build must be in the same Region.
StorageLocation.markdownDescription:
Information indicating where your game build files are stored. Use this parameter only when creating a build with files stored in an Amazon S3 bucket that you own. The storage location must specify an Amazon S3 bucket name and key. The location must also specify a role ARN that you set up to allow Amazon GameLift to access your Amazon S3 bucket. The S3 bucket and your new build must be in the same Region.

---

Required: No  
Type:   
Update requires: Replacement

Version.description: Version information that is associated with this build. Version strings do not need to be unique.
Version.markdownDescription:
Version information that is associated with this build. Version strings do not need to be unique.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

ServerSdkVersion.description: A server SDK version you used when integrating your game server build with Amazon GameLift. By default Amazon GameLift sets this value to 4.0.2.
ServerSdkVersion.markdownDescription:
A server SDK version you used when integrating your game server build with Amazon GameLift. By default Amazon GameLift sets this value to 4.0.2.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: Replacement

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.
Tags.markdownDescription:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

BuildArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift build resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. In a GameLift build ARN, the resource ID matches the BuildId value.
BuildArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift build resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. In a GameLift build ARN, the resource ID matches the BuildId value.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Pattern: ^arn:.*:build\/build-\S+  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

BuildId.description: A unique identifier for a build to be deployed on the new fleet. If you are deploying the fleet with a custom game build, you must specify this property. The build must have been successfully uploaded to Amazon GameLift and be in a READY status. This fleet setting cannot be changed once the fleet is created.

The build must have been successfully uploaded to Amazon GameLift and be in a READY status. This fleet setting cannot be changed once the fleet is created.

---

Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

BuildArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift build resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. In a GameLift build ARN, the resource ID matches the BuildId value.
